fr:mainmatter.fr:p: A clan is a small category \mathcal {C} together with a distinguished class of arrows called display maps, such that:

fr:ol.fr:li: Display maps are closed under composition: the composite of two composable display maps is a display map.
\mathcal {C} has a terminal object, and every map into the terminal object is a display map.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: A clan morphism is a functor between clans which preserves display maps, pullbacks of display maps, and the terminal object. \mathsf {Clan} is the 2-category of clans, clan morphisms, and natural transformations between them.
